text: [Music]
welcome to the class in genetic
engineering and biotechnology I'm Mike
Snider professor and chair of
genetics in this class we're going to
learn about three topics we're going to
learn about methods for genetically
engineering organisms we're going to
learn about their applications of
biotechnology and we're going to learn
basic principles about drugs and their
development we're going to learn all
about the methods the history and the
current ones for manipulating organisms
of All Sorts microorganisms yeast plants
animals and even
humans we're going to learn about how
genetic engineering is dramatically
changing biotechnology and
revolutionizing Industry we're going to
cover the basic types of drugs and how
they're developed we're going to even
talk a little bit about regulation of
drugs and V various methods of drug
Discovery overall it's going to be an
exciting class we hope you're really
going to enjoy it
[Music]
